intro: Gynoxys haenkei, commonly known as the golden star or yellow star, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling stars. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Gynoxys haenkei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
